paragraphs.english:
Jialin lowered his head and smiled, thinking for a moment, and clapped his hands, "Now I've become confused! I'm forgetful and annoying, and I'm not as I used to be." Yan laughed and said, "You can't blame it. There are many things and many words. If you drink two more cups of wine, you won't remember so much." As he said this, he stood up to leave. Jialin hurriedly stood up and said, "Good sister, sit down for a while, I have something to ask you." He said, "The maid, why not make a good cup of tea? Get a clean cover bowl and make a bowl of yesterday's new tea!" He said, "In the past few days, because of the centennial of the old lady, all the thousands of silver dollars have been used up. The rent and rent of several places will be unified in September, and this is the time when the money is not enough. The saying goes, 'Seeking others is not as good as seeking yourself.' Please take the blame and secretly transport a box of silver and gold objects that the old lady can't find, and borrow a thousand or two silver dollars to get by. InQingyang heard this and laughed, saying, "You're really a clever person! How did you come up with such a good idea?" Jialin laughed and answered, "Not to brag, except for you, there's no one else who can manage several thousand taels of silver. But they're all too cowardly to do anything. So I'll 'ring the bell once, but not play the cymbals three thousand times.'" He was still talking when one of the little maids from Jialin's room rushed over to tell Qingyang, "Grandmother is looking for you. I've been looking all over and finally found you here." Qingyang quickly went to see Jialin.
